name: Soy-Honey Glazed Salmon with Asparagus
author: Casie Price
summary: Lovely low-ingredient seafood meal! Serve with your choice of grain if needed. Also would be good with other veggies. This recipe is easy to double for larger families.
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh asparagus, trimmed, or as desired
1 teaspoon olive oil, or as needed
sea salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
Add asparagus, cover, and steam until slightly tender, 2 to 4 minutes
Whisk soy sauce and honey together in a bowl until glaze is smooth
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and brush with olive oil
Place salmon fillet and asparagus on the prepared baking sheet; season with salt and pepper
Broil in the preheated oven for 5 minutes
Drizzle 2/3 of the glaze over salmon and asparagus
Broil until fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 5 minutes
